intro: Minuartia howellii, commonly known as Howell's sandparsley, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant has small, green, lance-shaped leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Minuartia howellii is notable for its ability to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water.
